cost.value: black sapphire with a gp value of at least the target's level Ã— 100

description.value: You wrench the target's soul away before it can pass on to the afterlife and imprison it in a black sapphire. While the soul is in the gem, the target can't be returned to life through any means, even powerful magic such as wish. If the gem is destroyed or bind soul is counteracted on the gem, the soul is freed. The gem has AC 16 and Hardness 10. A gem can't hold more than one soul, and any attempt wastes the spell.

target.value: 1 creature that died within the last minute

description.value:
You point your finger toward the target and speak a word of slaying. You deal 70 void damage to the target. If the damage from finger of death reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target dies instantly.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 10.

You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Netherworld, or the Outer Rifts. You must have specific knowledge of the destination plane and use a magic tuning fork created from material from that plane as a focus for the spell. While the tuning forks for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell plane shift, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare tuning forks. The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20x25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Plane shift doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting plane shift again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.

target.value: 1 willing creature, or up to 8 willing creatures joining hands

description.value:
You magically spy on a creature of your choice. Scrying works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Clairvoyance], except that the image you receive is less precise, insufficient for teleport and similar spells. Instead of creating an eye in a set location within 500 feet, you instead create an eye that manifests just above the target. You can choose a target either by name or by touching one of its possessions or a piece of its body. If you haven't met the target in person, scrying's DC is 2 lower, and if you are unaware of the target's identity (perhaps because you found an unknown creature's fang at a crime scene), the DC is instead 10 lower. The effect of scrying depends on the target's Will save.

Critical Success The spell fails and the target is temporarily immune for 1 week. The target also gains a glimpse of you and learns its rough distance and direction from you.

Success The spell fails and the target is temporarily immune for 1 day.

Failure The spell succeeds.

Critical Failure The spell succeeds, and the eye follows the target if it moves, traveling up to 60 feet per round.

You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

Extending a finger, you fire a beam of void energy that weakens the life force of any creature it touches. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[persistent,void]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[persistent,void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[persistent,void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Doomed]{Doomed 1}.

Heightened (+2) The persistent void damage increases by @Damage[1d8[persistent,void]] damage on a success, or by @Damage[2d8[persistent,void]] damage on a failure or critical failure.

Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.
This 6-foot staff has a 2-foot-long, slightly curved, swordlike blade attached at one end. The long pole helps keep the wielder out of reach of swords and shorter weapons.

items.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

description.value:
The shinigami takes on the appearance of a specific Small or Medium humanoid creature. This doesn't change their statistics, other than to remove the reach trait from their Strikes. The shinigami's human shape is unique to the shinigami and can't be used to Impersonate a creature.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Each shinigami carries a pouch containing four black sapphires for use with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seize Soul]. Each gem is capable of holding a soul of a maximum level equal to that of the shinigami. If the shinigami dies, the gems are destroyed as well, and any souls they contain are released harmlessly to travel to the Boneyard.

Requirements One of the gems in the shinigami's pouch contains a soul from bind soul

Effect The shinigami crushes the gem, sending the soul to the Boneyard while releasing a wave of necromantic energy. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take 18d6 damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:38|basic:true] save); the shinigami chooses whether this damage is @Damage[18d6[vitality]]{vitality} damage or @Damage[18d6[void]]{void} damage. A creature who takes damage from this effect and fails the saving throw is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Drained]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).
A shinigami's Strikes can affect incorporeal creatures with the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Ghost Touch] property rune.

allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

details.publicNotes:
Even immortals such as kami aren't immune to death. When a kami or equally powerful entity refuses the call of the Boneyard, a shinigami is summoned to bring these stubborn souls to heel. Exact and swift, shinigami are known to dispense the judgment of death efficiently and dispassionately.

Guardians Of The Cycle

Shinigami are responsible for investigating and dealing with widespread phenomena that disrupt the natural flow of life. They might be tasked with solving the issue or be told to wait, observe, and provide minimal assistance. While most shinigami can retain their impartiality during such long vigils, some are far from emotionless and end up wavering toward mercy or cruelty.

publication.title: Pathfinder #196: The Summer That Never Was
